RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduaзгo em Ciкncias: Habilitaзгo Quimica pelo Centro Universitario Diocesano do Sudoeste do Parana (2004), mestrado em Ciкncias pelo Instituto de Quнmica de Sгo Carlos (2009), doutorado em Energia Alternativa - Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche (2012) e doutorado em Ciкncias pelo Instituto de Quнmica de Sгo Carlos (2013). Pуs-doc (2014) Consiglio Nazionale delle Ricerche. Atualmente й pesquisador (11/2019)- Istituto di Tecnologie Avanzate per l?Energia ?Nicola Giordano? . Tem experiкncia na бrea de Quнmica, com кnfase em Eletroquнmica, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: eletrуlise alcalina, materiais nгo criticos, materiais nгo nobres para reaзгo de evoluзгo de oxigкnio.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Ciкncias: Habilitaзгo Quimica from Centro Universitario Diocesano do Sudoeste do Parana (2004) and master's at Fнsico Quнmica from Instituto de Quнmica de Sгo Carlos (2009). , acting on the following subjects: pem fuel cell, cйlula eletroquнmica, estabilidade pt-ni, oxygen reduction and eletrocatalisadores pt-ni.

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: O projeto busca primeiramente estudar catalisadores alternativos а platina pura para serem utilizados em cйlula a combustнvel de etanol/O2 e verificar sua eficiкncia e а intermediбrios de reaзгo no caso de etanol. Com relaзгo aos produtos gerados durante a reaзгo de eletrooxidaзгo do etanol, se conhecidos, podem ser devidamente tratados de modo que se convertam em produtos inofensivos ao meio ambiente podendo ser descartados sem maiores problemas. A vantagem da cйlula alimentada com etanol, se todos objetivos forem alcanзados, se resume no benefнcio que o uso desses conversores de energia pode trazer. Alйm de um alto rendimento e geraзгo de produtos ?limpos?, o uso de um combustнvel totalmente renovбvel serviria de estнmulo para um consumo cada vez maior de etanol.

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.INSTITUICAO-PROMOTORA: Intituto de Quнmica de Sгo Carlos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The objective of this study is to find materials with similar activity compared with Pt and good durability. Catalyst durability is an additional factor for consideration, limiting the commercialization of PEMFCs.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The objective of this study is to find materials with similar activity compared with Pt and good durability. Catalyst durability is an additional factor for consideration, limiting the commercialization of PEMFCs.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Performance of a DEFC for PtxSny/C catalysts prepared with formic acid

DETALHAMENTO-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: XXIV Congresso Nazionale della Societа Chimica Italiana

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: There is presently a great interest on Direct Alcohol Fuel Cells, particularly on the Direct Ethanol Fuel Cell (DEFC), because it is a renewable and low toxic fuel. Pure platinum is not the most efficient anode catalyst for DEFC, because its surface is rapidly poisoned by strongly adsorbed species coming from the dissociative adsorption of ethanol. Thus, addition of a second metal has been proposed to alleviate this problem. In this sense, tin has demonstrated to be the most effective one. However, the performance and efficient to ethanol oxidation of PtSn catalyst highly depends on its composition and structural characteristics (degree of alloying and oxide content). In this sense, this work intends to elucidate the effect of the composition of different PtSn/C catalysts prepared by reduction with formic acid, using different reducing agent (formic acid) concentration.

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: STUDY OF STABILITY ON DIRECT ETHANOL FUEL CELL BASED ON A Pt3Sn1/C ANODE CATALYST
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: STUDY OF STABILITY ON DIRECT ETHANOL FUEL CELL BASED ON A Pt3Sn1/C ANODE CATALYST

DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO: Investigation of Pt-based catalysts for ethanol electro-oxidation
PERFORMANCE AND EFFICIENCY OF A DEFC WITH PtxSn/C CATALYSTS PREPARED WITH DIFFERENT REDUCING AGENT CONCENTRATION
DADOS-BASICOS-DA-APRESENTACAO-DE-TRABALH.TITULO-INGLES: PERFORMANCE AND EFFICIENCY OF A DEFC WITH PtxSN/C CATALYSTS PREPARED WITH DIFFERENT REDUCING AGENT CONCENTRATION

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Carbon supported Pt?Sn alloy catalysts were prepared by reduction of Pt and Sn precursors with formic acid. Modifying the Pt/Sn ratio and the reducing agent concentration significantly influences the cell performance and product distribution of the cell. A physicochemical investigation was carried out to support the interpretation of electrochemical results. Chronoamperometries carried out at 70є C and 90є C allowed it to identify the reaction products of ethanol electro-oxidation and their distribution for different catalyst catalysts. Optimum catalyst composition in terms of cell performance was found to be a Pt/Sn ratio of 3:1, even though large amounts of incomplete oxidation products are still produced.
